eu.opends.environment

Class XMLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.opends.environment.XMLParser

  • public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object
    XMLParser allows XML parsing of strings and files in order to evaluate traffic light instructions either manually generated or by the external SUMO traffic simulator. Furthermore this class provides a method to parse files that contain traffic light rules, traffic light phases and traffic light position data.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Detail

      • XMLParser

        public XMLParser(java.lang.String xmlstring)
        Creates a DOM-object from the given input string. If the input string is not a valid XML string, a warning message will be returned.
        Parameters:
        xmlstring - XML input string to parse

      • XMLParser

        public XMLParser(java.io.File xmlfile)
        Creates a DOM-object from the given input file. If the input file does not contain a valid XML string, a warning message will be returned.
        Parameters:
        xmlfile - XML input file to parse

    • Method Detail

      • evalTrafficLightInstructions

        public void evalTrafficLightInstructions()
        Searches the given XML string for traffic light instructions. External instructions from the SUMO traffic simulator and manual instructions will be distinguished.

      • evalCANInstruction

        public void evalCANInstruction(Simulator sim,
                               CANClient canClient)
        Searches the given XML string for CAN-bus instructions like steering wheel angle, status of brake and gas pedal. Settings of the car will be adjusted
        Parameters:
        sim - Simulator
        canClient - CAN client class

      • parseSUMOStateCharacter

        public static TrafficLight.TrafficLightState parseSUMOStateCharacter(char stateChar)
                                                              throws InvalidStateCharacterException
        Transforms SUMO's character representation of states to a value of TrafficLightState. E.g. 'r' --> TrafficLightState.RED
        Parameters:
        stateChar - A SUMO state character
        Returns:
        The corresponding traffic light state representation
        Throws:
        InvalidStateCharacterException - InvalidStateCharacterException will be thrown on invalid character input

      • getCharacterDataFromElement

        public static java.lang.String getCharacterDataFromElement(org.w3c.dom.Element elem)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns character data from XML element. E.g. <elem>abc123</elem> --> "abc123"
        Parameters:
        elem - XML Element
        Returns:
        string representation of the given element
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception will be thrown if no character data available

      • evalMultiDriverInstruction

        public void evalMultiDriverInstruction(Simulator sim,
                                       MultiDriverClient client)
